children.subject: 162 and 170 should be fine! Both are core courses and will help with recruiting.

history.content:
We are attempting to move final exam groups, with the support of the instructors, for the following upper division cs classes: CS170, CS186, CS 188.  (CS 161 and 189 will remain in exam group 14).  Given webcasting of lectures, this will allow students to take any combination of the 5 classes listed above (except 161 and 189 unless one of those instructors is willing to give an alternate exam to students with conflicts).

UPDATE: 95 out of 100 -- CS186 will be moved to exam group 3.

                                        CS170 will be moved to exam group 6. 

                                        CS188 will be moved to exam group 10.

<<These changes have been approved by EECS via the chairs and the Campus Scheduling office has confirmed capacity. They formally have to be approved by a campus faculty committee in the Academic Senate which may take a while to meet but in my 20+ years has never turned down a request with this level of support.>>

Also, while CS170 might not allow time conflicts but that is only a barrier if the other class you are interested in signing up for that conflicts also doesn't allow time conflicts. If you sign up for two classes and one doesn't approve time conflicts, you should probably make more of an effort to attend that lecture in person (assuming room capacity) but otherwise you're fine.

We are attempting to move final exam groups, with the support of the instructors, for the following upper division cs classes: CS170, CS186, CS 188.  (CS 161 and 189 will remain in exam group 14).  Given webcasting of lectures, this will allow students to take any combination of the 5 classes listed above (except 161 and 189 unless one of those instructors is willing to give an alternate exam to students with conflicts).

When I know which exam groups they are likely to move to (waiting on campus to give an estimate of when that will be), I will post that information here and it will go in the notes on the class schedule.

Also, while CS170 might not allow time conflicts but that is only a barrier if the other class you are interested in signing up for that conflicts also doesn't allow time conflicts. If you sign up for two classes and one doesn't approve time conflicts, you should probably make more of an effort to attend that lecture in person (assuming room capacity) but otherwise you're fine.

Also

We are attempting to move final exam groups, with the support of the instructors, for the following upper division cs classes: CS170, CS186, CS 188.  (CS 161 and 189 will remain in exam group 14).  Given webcasting of lectures, this will allow students to take any combination of the 5 classes listed above (except 161 and 189 unless one of those instructors is willing to give an alternate exam to students with conflicts).

When I know which exam groups they are likely to move to (probably sometime the week of April 20), I will post that information here and it will go in the notes on the class schedule.

Also, while CS170 might not allow time conflicts but that is only a barrier if the other class you are interested in signing up for that conflicts also doesn't allow time conflicts. If you sign up for two classes and one doesn't approve time conflicts, you should probably make more of an effort to attend that lecture in person (assuming room capacity) but otherwise you're fine.

Also

children.subject: CalCentral will only block enrollment if two courses conflict and both disallow time conflicts. It does not directly check for final exam conflicts (ever). The responsibility though to avoid final exam conflicts (or negotiate for alternate solutions which faculty are not required to provide) rests with the student.

My enrollment period is on April 20th. I'm trying to take CS 170 and CS 186 or 189. All three classes are held at the same time next semester. Can I still enroll in these classes on CalCentral for now given that they'll move final exam groups?
Just to confirm, CS186 and CS188 will be webcasted during Fall 2020?
To clarify, I am unable to enroll in both classes.
I'm trying to enroll in a stats class that conflicts with CS 186, but doesn't 186 allow time conflicts? Or will that be updated soon?
is there any update on when how and when these changes will get approved. As I am enrolled in both 170 and 188 but calcentral shows a timing conflict for the exams

history.content:
I just finished all my lower divs and plan to start taking upper divs next semester as a junior, starting with 170 which doesn't allow time conflicts. 186 and 188 both conflict with 170, and taking 162 with 170 doesn't seem like a good idea due to the amount of workload. Furthermore, 161 shares the same final exam as 170.

It seems like my options are exhausted if I want to take the "core" upper divs that are most useful to industry. Are there good alternatives? I was originally planning to take 170 and 186 together and taking 162 in the spring. Would it be better to take 162 before 170 given the scheduling?
history.subject: First Upper Divs to take, given time conflicts
